grammarPoints.usage: Express completed actions in recent past
grammarPoints.example: J'ai mangé une pomme
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: I ate an apple / I have eaten an apple

grammarPoints.meaning: Present perfect tense with être (for movement verbs)
grammarPoints.usage: Express movement or reflexive actions in past
grammarPoints.example: Je suis allé à Paris
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: I went to Paris / I have gone to Paris

grammarPoints.example: J'ai fait mes devoirs
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: I did my homework

grammarPoints.usage: Express habitual or repeated past actions
grammarPoints.example: Je parlais français tous les jours
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: I spoke French every day

grammarPoints.meaning: Imperfect forms of être and avoir
grammarPoints.usage: j'étais, tu étais, il était / j'avais, tu avais, il avait
grammarPoints.example: Il y avait une maison blanche
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: There was a white house

grammarPoints.meaning: Distinguishing between ongoing and completed past actions
grammarPoints.usage: Imparfait for background, passé composé for events
grammarPoints.example: Je parlais quand il est arrivé
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: I was speaking when he arrived

grammarPoints.usage: je parlerai, tu parleras, il parlera
grammarPoints.example: Je mangerai demain
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: I will eat tomorrow

grammarPoints.usage: aller → irai, avoir → aurai, être → serai, faire → ferai
grammarPoints.example: Je serai à la maison demain
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: I will be at home tomorrow

grammarPoints.example: Je voudrais un café, s'il vous plaît
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: I would like a coffee, please

grammarPoints.example: Si je gagne à la loterie, j'achèterai une maison
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: If I win the lottery, I will buy a house

grammarPoints.usage: Express what would happen in imaginary situations
grammarPoints.example: Si j'étais riche, j'achèterais une villa
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: If I were rich, I would buy a villa

grammarPoints.example: Mon frère est plus grand que moi
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: My brother is taller than me

grammarPoints.example: Cette voiture est moins chère que l'autre
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: This car is less expensive than the other one

grammarPoints.example: Elle parle aussi bien que son frère
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: She speaks as well as her brother

grammarPoints.usage: Express the highest or lowest degree
grammarPoints.example: C'est le plus grand bâtiment de la ville
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: It is the tallest building in the city

grammarPoints.example: C'est le meilleur restaurant de Paris
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: It is the best restaurant in Paris

grammarPoints.pattern: Possessive pronouns: le mien, la mienne, les miens
grammarPoints.example: Ce livre est le mien
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: This book is mine

grammarPoints.example: Je préfère celui-ci à celui-là
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: I prefer this one to that one

grammarPoints.usage: Create complex sentences with relative clauses
grammarPoints.example: L'homme qui parle est mon père
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: The man who is speaking is my father

grammarPoints.usage: Express possession or relationship with de
grammarPoints.example: La fille dont je parle est ma cousine
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: The girl I'm talking about is my cousin

grammarPoints.usage: Use after prepositions instead of que
grammarPoints.example: La maison dans laquelle j'habite est vieille
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: The house in which I live is old

grammarPoints.example: Je ne vais jamais au cinéma
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: I never go to the cinema

grammarPoints.example: Je n'habite plus à Lyon
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: I no longer live in Lyon

grammarPoints.example: Je ne vois rien
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: I see nothing

grammarPoints.example: Je ne vois personne
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: I see no one

grammarPoints.example: Je n'aime ni le café ni le thé
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: I like neither coffee nor tea

grammarPoints.example: Je n'ai aucune idée
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: I have no idea

grammarPoints.usage: Usually after verb or at sentence end
grammarPoints.example: Il parle très bien français
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: He speaks French very well

grammarPoints.meaning: Beaucoup, un peu, assez, trop, très
grammarPoints.example: Il y a beaucoup de monde
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: There are many people

grammarPoints.example: Je vais souvent au marché
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: I often go to the market

grammarPoints.example: Je vais au cinéma demain
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: I'm going to the cinema tomorrow

grammarPoints.pattern: Prepositions: à, de, en, par, pour, avec, sans
grammarPoints.example: Je vais à Paris avec mon ami
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: I'm going to Paris with my friend

grammarPoints.example: Je travaille ici depuis trois ans
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: I've been working here for three years

grammarPoints.example: Le film commence après le dîner
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: The film begins after dinner

grammarPoints.usage: Faire du sport est bon pour la santé
grammarPoints.example: Je veux apprendre l'espagnol
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: I want to learn Spanish

grammarPoints.usage: de + infinitive, à + infinitive, pour + infinitive
grammarPoints.example: J'ai peur de parler
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: I'm afraid to speak

grammarPoints.pattern: Reflexive verbs: se laver, se coucher, s'habiller
grammarPoints.example: Je me lave les mains
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: I wash my hands

grammarPoints.usage: Use être as auxiliary with reflexive verbs
grammarPoints.example: Je me suis levé à sept heures
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: I got up at seven o'clock

grammarPoints.pattern: Reciprocal verbs: se voir, s'aimer, se parler
grammarPoints.example: Ils se voient tous les jours
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: They see each other every day

grammarPoints.example: Dépêche-toi!
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: Hurry up!

grammarPoints.example: Je te le donne
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: I give it to you

grammarPoints.usage: Refers to places or prepositional phrases
grammarPoints.example: Je vais à la gare. J'y vais à dix heures
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: I'm going to the station. I'm going there at ten o'clock

grammarPoints.example: J'aime les gâteaux. J'en mange souvent
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: I like cakes. I eat some often

grammarPoints.example: Quel jour préfères-tu?
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: Which day do you prefer?

grammarPoints.example: De ces deux livres, lequel préfères-tu?
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: Which of these two books do you prefer?

grammarPoints.example: Combien de frères as-tu?
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: How many brothers do you have?

grammarPoints.usage: Je me demande où tu habites
grammarPoints.example: Peux-tu me dire quand tu arrives?
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: Can you tell me when you arrive?

grammarPoints.example: En marchant, j'ai vu mon ami
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: While walking, I saw my friend

grammarPoints.usage: Use after expressions of doubt, necessity, emotion
grammarPoints.example: Je veux que tu sois heureux
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: I want you to be happy

grammarPoints.usage: Subjunctive after certain verbs and expressions
grammarPoints.example: Je pense qu'il est riche / Je doute qu'il soit riche
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: I think he is rich / I doubt he is rich

grammarPoints.example: Il faut que tu études davantage
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: You must study more

grammarPoints.pattern: Je veux que / J'aime que + subjunctive
grammarPoints.meaning: I want that / I like that
grammarPoints.example: J'aime que tu sois ponctuel
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: I like that you are punctual

grammarPoints.example: Bien que je sois fatigué, je vais travailler
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: Although I am tired, I will work

grammarPoints.example: Je lui ai expliqué pour qu'il comprenne
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: I explained to him so that he would understand

grammarPoints.example: Je viendrai à moins qu'il fasse mauvais temps
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: I will come unless the weather is bad

grammarPoints.usage: Express that action is done to the subject
grammarPoints.example: La maison est construite par un architecte
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: The house is built by an architect

grammarPoints.example: La lettre a été écrite hier
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: The letter was written yesterday

grammarPoints.example: Je fais réparer ma voiture
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: I am having my car repaired

grammarPoints.meaning: To let / allow someone to do something
grammarPoints.example: Je laisse mon enfant jouer
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: I let my child play

grammarPoints.meaning: Must / should vs must be / probably
grammarPoints.example: Je dois partir / Il doit être tard
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: I must leave / It must be late

grammarPoints.pattern: Pouvoir: ability vs permission vs possibility
grammarPoints.example: Je peux nager / Tu peux entrer / Il peut arriver
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: I can swim / You may enter / He might arrive

grammarPoints.pattern: Agreement of past participle with avoir
grammarPoints.usage: Agree when direct object precedes verb
grammarPoints.example: La lettre que j'ai écrite
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: The letter that I wrote

grammarPoints.pattern: Agreement of past participle with être
grammarPoints.meaning: Agreement in compound tenses with être
grammarPoints.example: Elle est allée / Ils sont allés
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: She went / They went

grammarPoints.pattern: Y and en: position in complex tenses
grammarPoints.meaning: Placement of y and en in compound tenses
grammarPoints.example: Je y suis allé / J'en ai mangé
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: I went there / I ate some

grammarPoints.example: Quel beau jour!
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: What a beautiful day!

grammarPoints.example: 'Comment vas-tu?' demanda-t-elle
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: 'How are you?' she asked

grammarPoints.pattern: Present tense of irregular verbs: boire, croire
grammarPoints.usage: je bois, tu bois / je crois, tu crois
grammarPoints.example: Je bois du café
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: I drink coffee

grammarPoints.pattern: Present tense of prendre and compounds
grammarPoints.usage: je prends, tu prends, il prend
grammarPoints.example: Je comprends la leçon
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: I understand the lesson

grammarPoints.pattern: Present tense of venir and tenir
grammarPoints.meaning: Conjugation of venir, tenir, venir de
grammarPoints.example: Je viens de Paris
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: I come from Paris

grammarPoints.example: Je viens de manger
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: I just ate

grammarPoints.pattern: Être en train de + infinitive (ongoing action)
grammarPoints.example: Je suis en train de travailler
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: I am working / I am in the process of working

grammarPoints.example: Je vais partir demain
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: I'm going to leave tomorrow

grammarPoints.meaning: When to use definite vs indefinite vs partitive
grammarPoints.example: J'aime le chocolat / Un café / Du pain
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: I like chocolate / A coffee / Some bread

grammarPoints.example: C'est un professeur
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: He is a teacher

grammarPoints.usage: Learn common expressions with avoir and être
grammarPoints.example: avoir faim, avoir peur, être en retard
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: to be hungry, to be afraid, to be late

grammarPoints.example: Je suis arrivé il y a deux heures
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: I arrived two hours ago

grammarPoints.usage: à, en, au, aux for countries and cities
grammarPoints.example: Je vais en France et au Japon
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: I'm going to France and Japan

grammarPoints.example: Il pleut, donc je reste à la maison
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: It's raining, so I'm staying home

grammarPoints.example: C'est absolument formidable!
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: It's absolutely amazing!

grammarPoints.example: C'est moi qui ai fait ça
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: It's I who did that / I'm the one who did that
